lead_paragraph: One of three people arrested, John Cramsey, whose 20-year-old daughter died of a drug overdose, posted on Facebook that he was going to Brooklyn to rescue a 16-year-old girl who was in trouble.

byline.contributor: Ashley Southall contributed reporting, and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By ELI ROSENBERG and NATE SCHWEBER

headline.print_headline: 3 Arrested at Holland Tunnel With Weapons; Stopped Over a Cracked Windshield
headline.main: Man Arrested With Guns at Holland Tunnel Says He Was on Anti-Drug Mission

snippet: One of three people arrested, John Cramsey, whose 20-year-old daughter died of a drug overdose, posted on Facebook that he was going to Brooklyn to rescue a 16-year-old girl who was in trouble.
abstract: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey police officers arrest three people outside Holland Tunnel after stopping them for cracked windshield and finding cache of illegal weapons and ammunition in car; John Cramsey, Dean Smith and Kimberly Arendt are charged with unlawful weapons possession, among other charges.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
